question_sentence: Which social media platform is considering charging for verified accounts on its site?
evidence: Twitter is considering a pay-for-verification feature that would give the coveted blue check marks only to users who are willing to pay $8 a month for a subscription service.

question_sentence: Which city this week agreed to pay $26 million to two men wrongly convicted of Malcolm X’s murder?
evidence: The 2020 Netflix documentary “Who Killed Malcolm X?” drew major attention to the case. Now, more than two years later, New York City agreed to pay a multimillion-dollar settlement to two men whose convictions in the 1965 assassination of Malcolm X were thrown out last November.

question_sentence: In addition to Halloween, which holiday was celebrated this week?
evidence: The Mexican holiday Día de los Muertos, also known as the Day of the Dead, extends over the first two days of November and was celebrated this week with colorful traditions to honor deceased loved ones.

question_sentence: A no-hitter was thrown this week for just the second time in World Series history. Which two teams are competing in Major League Baseball’s championship?
evidence: This is the fourth World Series in six years for the Houston Astros. Playing the underdog role are the Philadelphia Phillies.

question_sentence: Which company said it will soon seek approval for the first vaccine to prevent respiratory syncytial virus — or RSV?
evidence: Pfizer said it will seek FDA approval this year for a vaccine to prevent RSV, a common respiratory virus that typically causes mild, cold-like symptoms. Worldwide, RSV causes about 33 million infections in children under the age of 5 and hospitalizes 3.6 million annually.

question_sentence: Benzene, a cancer-causing chemical, was recently detected in several batches of which common household product?
evidence: Certain dry shampoos – including some Dove, Nexxus, Suave, TIGI and TRESemmé products – were voluntarily recalled because of the potential presence of benzene. This week, a new report from an independent laboratory called the levels of benzene in the products “troubling.”

question_sentence: House Speaker Nancy Pelosi’s husband, Paul Pelosi, was recently attacked in a violent home break-in. In which city did the attack occur?
evidence: After being attacked at his San Francisco residence, Paul Pelosi is “making steady progress on what will be a long recovery process,” Speaker Pelosi said in a statement. Court documents released this week showed that the man arrested in the assault allegedly awoke Paul Pelosi by standing over his bedside.

question_sentence: Which “extremely rare” item is expected to fetch up to $30 million at an upcoming auction?
choices: First-edition copy of the US Constitution
evidence: A first-edition copy of the US Constitution will go under the hammer in New York next month, Sotheby’s said. The announcement comes less than a year after the only other privately-held copy fetched a record $43.2 million at auction.

question_sentence: Which animals slipped loose from their enclosure at a Sydney zoo this week, prompting a full lockdown?
evidence: Some guests were rushed to safety after five lions managed a brief escape from their enclosure at Sydney’s Taronga Zoo. No people or animals were injured in the incident.

question_sentence: Which of the following was awarded the world’s best cheese for 2022?
evidence: This year’s winner, a gruyere from Switzerland, rose above more than 4,400 cheeses to claim the title.

question_sentence: The World Series has seen only 2 no-hitters. The Astros threw the second, dominating the Phillies in Game 4 this week. Which team had the first?
Takeoff, one-third of rap group Migos, died at age 28 in a Houston shooting on Halloween. Which is a Migos song?
Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva defeated Jair Bolsonaro in Brazil’s presidential runoff election. Lula da Silva was also president in:
The Brooklyn Nets fired head coach Steve Nash this week. Which of these players did not play for him during his tenure?
Which of these celebrities hasn’t announced their departure from Twitter following Elon Musk’s purchase of the platform?
The Federal Reserve announced a new interest rate hike this week. Which of these may actually become more affordable with the rate hike?
Country singer Luke Bryan received backlash on social media after bringing out which politician at a show?
Republican Ohio Senate candidate J.D. Vance is the author of which book?
Actor Matthew Perry’s debut memoir was released on Nov. 1. The actor is best known for which sitcom?
Starbucks’ holiday menu is back! This drink was introduced last year and has returned for the season.
Matt Hancock has been suspended from the Tory party after signing up to take part in which reality TV show?
evidence: The former health secretary’s decision to miss up to three weeks of Parliament to film the show in the Australian jungle was condemned by his local West Suffolk Conservative Association as ‘a serious error of judgement’

question_sentence: Denmark’s Social Democrats have clung on to power after securing what percentage of the vote in this week’s general election?
evidence: Mette Frederiksen will serve as prime minister for a second term after the centre-left bloc that she leads secured the 90 seats needed for a majority

question_sentence: Elon Musk is proposing to charge Twitters users how much per month to keep their blue tick verification?
evidence: Although the fee was initially expected to be $20, Musk is still facing widespread criticism over his plans for his newly acquired social media platform

question_sentence: Which of the following has been named Word of the Year for 2022 by Collins Dictionary?
evidence: The dictionary said the portmanteau ‘sums up quite succinctly just how truly awful 2022 has been for so many people’. Find out more with The Week Unwrapped podcast

question_sentence: Demonstrators in Halloween costumes marched in cities across the UK last weekend to protest against what?
evidence: The ‘March of the Mummies’ national protest was organised by Pregnant Then Screwed, a charity that campaigns for better financial support for parents

question_sentence: Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva has reclaimed the Brazilian presidency after previously holding the role when?
evidence: Widely known as Lula, the leftist leader narrowly defeated incumbent Jair Bolsonaro in the run-off election by securing 50.9% of the vote

question_sentence: What did model Heidi Klum dress up as for her latest annual Halloween party?
evidence: Klum told reporters that she felt ‘quite claustrophobic’ in her full-body costume for the bash in New York City, where she was flanked by her musician husband Tom Kaulitz as a fisherman with a gouged-out eye

question_sentence: Ministers have reportedly ‘war gamed’ emergency plans to deal with what potential scenario this winter?
evidence: According to The Guardian, official documents warned that in a ‘reasonable worst-case scenario’ of a power outage, all sectors could be ‘severely disrupted’ for up to a week

question_sentence: Recent visitors to Shanghai Disney Resort got trapped inside the park for what reason?
choices: A search for a missing child
evidence: Footage showed visitors rushing to the gates only to find them locked, as the park enforced China’s strict zero-Covid policy on Monday following an outbreak in the city

question_sentence: Which of the following high-profile figures has said they will not be attending Cop27?
evidence: The teenage eco-activist has described the UN climate summit, which kicks off on Sunday in Egypt, as a ‘scam’ that allows ‘greenwashing, lying and cheating’ to continue
